intro: Haplostylis bahiensis, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and fruit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
